title: [bug] Product name not used for application name on Android

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

The `productName` is not used for the application name on Android. Instead the launcher shows the `mainBinaryName`.

### Reproduction

Create a new Tauri 2.x application.
Use the following **tauri.conf.json** and **Cargo.toml** configuration:

**tauri.conf.json**
```
"productName": "Foo Application",
"mainBinaryName": "foo-application"
```

**Cargo.toml**
```
"[package].name": "foo-application"
```

Attempt to build and deploy to an Android emulator.
The name of the application in the launcher is "foo-application" not "Foo Application".

### Expected behavior

The application name should match the `productName` property. This is the current behaviour on desktop platforms i.e. macOS.

### Full `tauri info` output
